intro: Thryallis rotundifolia, commonly known as the round-leaf thryallis, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in wetlands or along riverbanks.
